Create Enhanced Marker Gene Heatmap

Source: R/marker_gene_visualization.R
create_marker_heatmap.Rd

Creates a publication-ready heatmap showing marker gene expression across cell types. The heatmap displays scaled expression values with hierarchical clustering of genes.

Usage

create_marker_heatmap(
  seurat_obj,
  markers_df,
  consensus_results,
  top_n = 5,
  title = "Marker Gene Expression Heatmap",
  color_palette = NULL,
  cluster_genes = TRUE,
  scale_method = "row",
  width = 4000,
  height = 3000,
  fontsize = 20,
  cellwidth = 100,
  cellheight = 50,
  margins = c(20, 20)
)

Arguments

seurat_obj

A Seurat object containing the single-cell data

markers_df

A data frame containing marker genes (output from FindAllMarkers)

consensus_results

Results from interactive_consensus_annotation function

top_n

Number of top marker genes to display per cell type (default: 5)

title

Plot title (default: "Marker Gene Expression Heatmap")

color_palette

Color palette for the heatmap (default: viridis::plasma)

cluster_genes

Whether to cluster genes hierarchically (default: TRUE)

scale_method

Scaling method: "row", "column", or "none" (default: "row")

width

Image width in pixels (default: 4000)

height

Image height in pixels (default: 3000)

fontsize

Base font size for the heatmap (default: 20)

cellwidth

Width of each cell in the heatmap (default: 100)

cellheight

Height of each cell in the heatmap (default: 50)

margins

Margins around the heatmap as c(bottom, right) (default: c(20, 20))

Value

A matrix containing the expression data used for the heatmap

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create heatmap with default settings (optimized for complete display)
heatmap_matrix <- create_marker_heatmap(
  seurat_obj = pbmc_data,
  markers_df = markers_df,
  consensus_results = consensus_results,
  top_n = 5
)

# Create heatmap with custom settings
heatmap_matrix <- create_marker_heatmap(
  seurat_obj = pbmc_data,
  markers_df = markers_df,
  consensus_results = consensus_results,
  top_n = 3,
  title = "Top 3 Marker Genes",
  fontsize = 16,
  cellwidth = 80,
  cellheight = 40,
  cluster_genes = FALSE
)
} # }
